name: places/ChIJK0sSv0xYwokRSyPIXPRA4Go
adrFormatAddress: 11th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA

originalText.text: I have been a loyal Verizon customer since 2000. A few years ago, I made the mistake of trusting Verizon w my business needs. Sadly, customer service is DEAD at Verizon. You will be plunged into a Kafkaesque nightmare if you call Verizon for tech support. This is my story: I have been dealing w a business-related tech issue for over 3 weeks now (I’m in healthcare and made the regrettable mistake of purchasing another line w an Insego device for faxing). They promised to send a tech out after all troubleshooting attempts failed. I never had any faith in the tech appointment as the appointment was never finalized and no one ever came. Frankly, I don’t even think such a service exists. They tell you what you want to hear but nothing is ever truly resolved. The outsourced “customer service” reps seem to have nerves of steel as they just echo your concerns until they wear you down. When I asked for the fax line to be suspended, they suspended the cellphone line from which I actually placed the call. Unable to use my phone as soon as I hung up with them, I was forced to drive to the nearest Verizon sales office and plead for help. While there, I waited over an hour as the salesperson was treated to the same rigamarole over the phone w tech support. Another time when I called for support, I was told my account “does not exist” and I had to spend an hour re-registering my business online. My calls for tech support feel like downright punishments: not only are my issues NOT resolved but a NEW problem gets created! Verizon’s lies, lack of concern and callous mental abuse feels like calling a towing company to get your car out of the pound. This company is negatively affecting my business profits as they are impeding process.

originalText.text: Verizon will nickel and dime you.  Beware.  Just switched 4 lines to Verizon.  Charged me $108.24 in the store, called it a start up fee.  Then got the first bill, charged $35 activation fee per line and an extra $10 per line because autopay isn't activated until your second bill (even though autopay was set up day 1).  That's $148.24 I was not expecting, was never explained.

originalText.text: Terrible customer service. You can’t reach a live person for help.

text.text: Terrible customer service. You can’t reach a live person for help.
